wikipedia_page.main: Frank Lester VC (18 February 1896 – 12 October 1918) was an English soldier in the British Army during the First World War, and recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy awarded to British Commonwealth forces.

response: * Corporal Frank Lester, 10th (Service) Battalion, Lancashire Fusiliers

response: |Frank Lester || British Army || 1918 || First World War  || Neuvilly

Irby has three churches. Two of these are the Irby Methodist Church and the Irby Evangelical Church. Meanwhile, St. Chad's Church is a branch of St Bartholomew's Church in Thurstaston. Frank Lester was a previous organist of the Methodist chapel.
* Frank Lester, recipient of the Victoria Cross.
